clinical_study.brief_title: Home Care Needs and Current Nursing Status of Patients With Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Home Care Needs and Current Nursing Status of Patients With Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to comprehensively investigate and analyze the home care needs and status quo of ALS patients in China, and to clarify their home care needs and status quo, so as to provide reference for the development of home care service planning and policy measures for ALS patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is the most common type of motor neuron disease. It is common in middle-aged and elderly people. Progressive skeletal muscle weakness, atrophy, fascicular fibrillation, bulbar paralysis and pyramidal tract sign are the main clinical manifestations. The survival time is usually 3-5 years. As the pathogenesis of ALS is not fully understood, there is no specific treatment for ALS. The clinical treatment mode of most patients with ALS is hospitalization at the end of the disease and maintenance treatment at home during the disease progression. At present, there are few reports on the home care needs and nursing status of ALS patients in China. This study is a cross-sectional survey. Based on consulting the relevant literature and consulting experts' opinions, the researchers designed the questionnaire of home care needs and nursing status of ALS patients, The convenience sampling method was used to select 126-252 ALS outpatients, 126-252 ALS inpatients, and 126-252 ALS family members from a third class a general hospital in Beijing. The needs and status of home care of ALS patients in China were comprehensively investigated and analyzed, and the needs and status of home care were clarified, so as to provide reference for the development of home care service planning and policy measures for ALS patients.

arm_group.description: Patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis undergoing home care.

intervention.description: The general information, home care status and functional status of ALS patients and family caregivers were collected.

study_pop.textblock: The outpatients, inpatients, discharged patients and their caregivers of ALS in a general hospital in Beijing.
